Name: Mask of Sheshonq the Second
Description: The funeral mask of King Sheshonq the Second was found on the pharaoh's mummy but was seriously damaged. It is made from a thick sheet of gold with hollow spaces for the eyes and the eyebrows where glass paste was to be inserted.It was fixed to the mummy by five small perforated tenons, three on the forehead and two below the ears. The facial features depict the king as a young man, in accordance with Egyptian artistic traditions, indicating that the deceased is to be resurrected at this young age.
